body:
r? @nikomatsakis

(rust_highfive has picked a reviewer for you, use r? to override)

I noticed at least one duplicate in the AUTHORS. There may be others:

```
GlacJAY <glacjay@gmail.com>
...
Jay True <glacjay@gmail.com>
```

I'm in the list twice:

```
Nick Hamann <nick@wabbo.org>
nham <hamann.nick@gmail.com>
```

You can remove the second one if you'd like.

There are 2 duplicated names (Alfie John and Jakub Wieczorek with different email addresses). I don't know if it's intentional or not, so I haven't tried to make a PR or anything. I found 23 duplicate email addresses (names are different, some use their middle name, some are 'handles').
@brson, I made a PR on your repo that removes the duplicates in what I _think_ is a sane way to go about it.
@cjwelborn Thanks! Merged.

@tshepang Under the normal release schedule, the beta of 4 weeks ago would not have its own release notes - those would be the release notes of the next stable release. So the thinking was to combine them to provide the full picture of what happened recently. The amount of new work that went into 1.0 this cycle was actually pretty small...

Beta's are not 'releases' even though we treated the last one as such.
Looks like I'm in there twice. Thanks @cjwelborn, but my preferred email for all things Rust is alfie@alfie.wtf :)
@alfiedotwtf, sorry about that. I'm glad you caught it before it was finalized.

D'oh! Looks like I had my email as my name in gitconfig. 

Any chance `dan@daramos.com <dan@daramos.com>` could be changed to `Daniel Ramos <dan@daramos.com>`?

Sorry about that...
If you're taking these last minute comments... `s/caipre/Nick Platt`
Could you update "Russell rpjohnst@gmail.com" to "Russell Johnston rpjohnst@gmail.com"?
Can someone move John Kleint out of my names?
Not sure why I decided to abbreviate my name. Could you change 'Ben S' to 'Ben Sago'? Ta

Please change `Chris Thorn <thorn@thoughtbot.com>` to `Chris Thorn <chris@thorn.co>`.

So much thanks to the Rust team for doing this! :heartpulse:
@ogham "Ben S" is the name associated with your github profile: https://github.com/ogham
@brson Is it any kind of code contribution that counts (ie commits in master)?
Could you change "TyOverby" to "Ty Overby"?  Thanks!
@laumann yes, any commit!
Could you please change "blackbeam" to "Anatoly Ikorsky"?

@huonw Awesome, then I'm missing from the list (see d14109ec7e90f42a7cb966415b96094b146d3706):
`Thomas Bracht Laumann Jespersen <laumann.thomas@gmail.com>`.

@laumann, oh, I apologise because I realise I may have misspoke: this is the first release where the release _isn't_ from the master branch, so some recent contributions may not be in it (I'm unsure if that commit is).
@huonw Oh, ok, that might be why - is it from the beta branch?

Minor thing: my full name is `Eduard-Mihai Burtescu` and the hyphen makes it so I can't omit `Mihai` in legal contexts.
I'm nor it matters here (for copyright/licensing?), but I thought I'd mention it.

After my email got spammed after that blogpost I created a gh alias.
It would be great if you could change `Florian Wilkens <floya@live.de>` to `Florian Wilkens <mrfloya_github@outlook.com>`. Thanks a lot!

> my email got spammed after that blogpost

I've also noticed this. I'm not sure how to handle this, as these are added automatically and the owner of the email address doesn't get a heads-up that this will happen. I don't want to complain or critizise, but I'd like to discuss how to handle this in the future. Automated email farmers don't seem to detect github commit authors, but they read through blog posts and files uploaded to github.
If it wouldn't be any trouble, changing `Dabo Ross` to `David Ross` would be nice. It really isn't that important or anything though, I think I contributed around two lines total.
Please replace nwin with `Nils Winter <nils.winter@gmail.com>`
@oli-obk hiding email addresses in git logs as opposed to blog posts is security through obscurity. It's either secret or not secret, there is no middle ground.
I'd like to change my email from `peter.elmers@yahoo.com` to `peter.elmers@rice.edu`. Thanks!

Hello,
Could you please change `m-r-r <raybaudroigm@gmail.com>` to `Mickaël Raybaud-Roig <raybaudroigm@gmail.com>` ?
Hi, could you please change inrustwetrust to John Talling?
Hello. Could you change iancormac84 to Nathan Wilson please?

Hello,
Could you please change `Herman J. Radtke III <hermanradtke@gmail.com>` to `Herman J. Radtke III <herman@hermanradtke.com>` ?
:umbrella: The latest upstream changes (presumably #25218) made this pull request unmergeable. Please resolve the merge conflicts.

@huonw 

> this is the first release where the release isn't from the master branch, so some recent contributions may not be in it (I'm unsure if that commit is).

If my minor contributions count, I'd like to be added:
- https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/24894
- https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/25054
- https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/25055
- https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/25068

@bguiz This is for the release which was branched last month, so your changes probably won't be credited until 1.1. (In six weeks? I can't remember whether 1.1 is planned to take 1 or 2 cycles.) Though maybe the doc changes _should_ be cherry-picked for 1.0, if they weren't already.

That said, I'm sure that it does count, since I'm credited and my contributions were probably even more minor before the 1.0 beta was branched.

You should probably change my email address to graydon@pobox.com, pretty sure the Mozilla one bounces now.

(Braces for uptick in spam)

@quantheory Thanks for the info. Yeah, I definitely think that all of those patches should be back-merged to 1.0, as they are definitely applicable. I'll leave it up to the reviewers/ core team to decide though.
@brson Please update my email to toffaletti@gmail.com, jason@topsy.com no longer exists.
By the way, `.mailmap` is where the correct e-mail mappings should go so that `git log` lists the right one out of the box.
@bguiz generally speaking, i'm going to backport the entire book right before release. You should get credit in this file, for sure. /cc @brson

@brson: I'm going through old PRs, here's a list of people who should be in for doc stuff. I didn't check to see if they were here or not, but they should be:
- @poga for https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/24982
- @carols10cents for https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/24981
- @hech for https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/24970
- @nham for https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/24961
- @tynopex for https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/24960
- @oli-obk for https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/24933
- @tcard for https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/24891
- @mbrubeck for https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/24871
- @dhardy for https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/24863
- @barometz for https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/24862
- @diwic for https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/24844
- @gbgamer for https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/24842
- @heejongahn for https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/24815
-  @gareins for https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/24849
- @aramvisser for https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/24496
- @jooert for https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/24783

If I missed anyone else, sorry! Trying to do best effort to pick up people who may have fallen through the cracks here.

This is me:
`Michał Czardybon <mczard@poczta.onet.pl>`

Initially figured I wouldn't bother since I just have the single one-line doc commit, but since I was mentioned, I would like to state for the literal record:

`Dominic van Berkel <dominic@baudvine.net>`

> since I just have the single one-line doc commit

All patches are valuable, no matter how small :)

Thanks for mentioning me as I just fixed a single "\n" in the doc :)

This is me: 
`Poga Po <poga.bahamut@gmail.com>`

Made #25286 and #25291

`Johann Hofmann <mail@johann-hofmann.com>`

Thanks!

Steve told me to post here about #25288 

```
Paul Quint <DrKwint@gmail.com>
```

Thank you!

thanks for the credit folks, can the email on https://github.com/brson/rust/blob/ea0c1ed71ef359b67ff56b19a667e8feebde5dd7/AUTHORS.txt#L965 just be changed to `João Oliveira <hello@jxs.pt>`?

thanks!
@Zoxc I didn't understand your comment.
@laumann Anybody with commits to this repo.
Updated with all comments addressed (I think) except @Zoxc's.
@brson My complaint was addressed atleast. I'm no longer listed twice.

I am:
`Ožbolt Menegatti <ozbolt.menegatti@gmail.com>`

If it needs to be ascii, just use 'z' instead of 'ž'. 

ps. Thanks everyone for an awesome language :)

If spellchecking is considered relevant contribution, please add

```
Przemek Wesołek <jest@go.art.pl>
```

due to https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/24812

If writing a postponed RFC is considered as a relevant contribution (maybe not, but I wanted to ask anyway :p), is it possible to add

```
KokaKiwi <kokakiwi+rust@kokakiwi.net>
```

Due to https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/pull/257
r=me whenever this is ready @brson
@bors: r=alexcrichton

:pushpin: Commit 94caeb3 has been approved by `alexcrichton`

<!-- @bors r=alexcrichton 94caeb326c45bd0a108abe92ae50f9deda0aeb4c -->
:hourglass: Testing commit 94caeb3 with merge a90dd32...
I've already picked this into beta, so setting tag to beta-accepted

:sunny: Test successful - [auto-linux-32-nopt-t](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-linux-32-nopt-t/builds/4898), [auto-linux-32-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-linux-32-opt/builds/4905), [auto-linux-64-nopt-t](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-linux-64-nopt-t/builds/4862), [auto-linux-64-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-linux-64-opt/builds/4886), [auto-linux-64-x-android-t](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-linux-64-x-android-t/builds/4855), [auto-mac-32-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-mac-32-opt/builds/4930), [auto-mac-64-nopt-t](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-mac-64-nopt-t/builds/4927), [auto-mac-64-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-mac-64-opt/builds/4898), [auto-win-32-nopt-t](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-win-32-nopt-t/builds/4590), [auto-win-32-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-win-32-opt/builds/4575), [auto-win-64-nopt-t](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-win-64-nopt-t/builds/3387), [auto-win-64-opt](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-win-64-opt/builds/3412)

I checked the authors file. It contains an old spam-infested email address, which is fine. Now somehow my github email appears in the 1.0 announcement, and right on queue I get a bunch of phishing emails. How'd that happen? I'm now going to have to replace the github email... don't put the new one in blog posts please.
@dhardy that's security through obscurity. All it takes is a bot to clone one of your repo to see your email address. Consider using temporary aliases for anything public facing.

```
Consider using temporary aliases for anything public facing.
```

That's precisely what it is, and mostly my system works (it seems bots are not in the habit of cloning repos). I only get spam on the gmail address and if anyone emails me there, they get an "out-of-office" reply notifying them that I don't read it frequently.
